Literature Review: The formation of the first stars, known as Population III (Pop III) stars, is a crucial aspect of understanding the early Universe. These metal-free stars dominate the cosmic star-formation history until z ∼ 15–20, when the formation of metal-enriched Population II stars takes over. Theoretical models have been developed to describe the formation, properties, and impact of Pop III stars, but significant uncertainties remain. This review aims to summarize the current state of knowledge on Pop III stars and discuss existing and future observational constraints.
